availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard B. George (Woodford County, Kentucky, deputy sheriff and farmer)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, deputy sheriff and farmer. Virginia native. Son of William W. George and Elizabeth B. George. Married to Martha Ann Todd George in Woodford County, Kentucky, in May 1860. Father of Mary T. George and William B. George. Student in Woodford County in 1850. Deputy sheriff in Woodford County in 1860. Deputy sheriff in Woodford County from 1861 to 1862. Farmer in Woodford County in 1863. Signed a loyalty oath to the U. S. government on July 3, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 2, p. 490A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 962.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 501A.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1862, Legislative Document Series, No. 24 (Frankfort, KY: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1863), 251.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Woodford County, KY, July 1863, p. 7.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film #000252335.
Union Provost Marshals' Papers, Union Provost Marshals' File of Papers Relating to Individual Civilians, 1861-1867_, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M0345, F-H, Ge-Gh.
"Richard Bohannon George (1833-1895)," Find A Grave, Memorial #57861660, accessed September 26, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/57861660.
